oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Army Day Parade, Nashville, Tennessee, 1942 April
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: “Marching Men Keynote of Wartime Army Day: Going through inspection drills at the bivouac at the State Fair Grounds this morning, Camp Forrest infantrymen, who later participated in the giant Army Day parade here, passed in review before their commanding officer, Col. H. H. Cartwright (left). The troops are members of the 131st Infantry, to which a motorized artillery unit had been attached.” Source: Nashville Banner, April 6th, 1942. Forms part of Record Group 412, Photographs Collection. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
